description: Fix iPad landscape mode responsiveness issues where canvas data is cut-off and buttons are obscured

problem_analysis.issue: Fixed max-height constraints (max-h-[500px], max-h-[400px]) in educational tools don't adapt to iPad landscape orientation
problem_analysis.impact: Canvas data cut-off, buttons obscured, poor user experience in landscape mode
problem_analysis.root_cause: Components use fixed pixel heights that don't account for reduced viewport height in landscape orientation

proposed_changes.justification: Reduce height in landscape mode to prevent overflow
Reduce height in landscape mode for better fit
Ensure main idea tool fits in landscape mode
Ensure map reading tool fits in landscape mode
Ensure latitude/longitude tool fits in landscape mode
Ensure scientific inquiry tool fits in landscape mode

responsive_strategy.approach: Use Tailwind CSS landscape orientation utilities
responsive_strategy.reasoning: Gradually reduce max-height in landscape orientations to prevent overflow while maintaining usability

medium_risk: Content might feel cramped in landscape mode
May need scrolling for very tall content
high_risk: Could affect component internal layouts if they depend on specific heights
Might impact canvas rendering if hardcoded to container dimensions

testing_requirements: Test all educational tools in iPad landscape mode
Verify canvas rendering still works correctly
Test on various tablet sizes and orientations
Ensure no regression in portrait mode

alternative_approaches.name: Dynamic height calculation
alternative_approaches.description: Use viewport units (vh) instead of fixed pixels

alternative_approaches.name: Orientation-specific layouts
alternative_approaches.description: Create separate layout components for landscape vs portrait
